results.query_detailed: A 23 years old presents with ABNORMAL BLOOD FATS (chief complaints). After questioning also indicates patient has: dyslipidemias.
results.analysis_summary:
A 23 years old presents with ABNORMAL BLOOD FATS (chief complaints). After questioning also indicates patient has: dyslipidemias.
ASSESMENT (AUTOMATED) CLINICALGPS TRIAGE LEVEL: 4
Most likely causes for abnormal blood fats include diabetes mellitus type 2, drugs and toxins, alcoholism, acute pancreatitis, and hypothyroidism.
Diabetes mellitus type 2 matches all the given symptoms.
Drugs and toxins matches all the given symptoms.
Alcoholism matches all the given symptoms.
Acute pancreatitis matches all the given symptoms.
Hypothyroidism matches all the given symptoms.
END AUTOMATED ASSESMENT
NOTES & COMMENTS

diagnosis.diagnosis_layman: multisystem disease due to insulin resistance and high blood sugar
diagnosis.diagnosis_symptoms: increased thirst, urinating often, vision problems, weakness
diagnosis.diagnosis_category: endocrine, eye diseases, nephrology, vascular problems
diagnosis.diagnosis_homecare: 1) Take your diabetes medication as directed, 2) Avoid alcohol and smoking and Avoid exposure to secondary smoke, 3) Check your blood pressure every day and Keep a log of your results., 4) Check your blood sugar every day and Keep a log of blood sugar results., 5) Follow an exercise plan as directed by your doctor., 6) Get regular dental checkups and practice good dental hygiene., 7) Get regular eye and foot examinations., 8) Inspect the skin of your feet and your nails every day, in order to look for injury., 9) Lose weight if you are overweight, 10) Take prescribed medications as directed., 11) Wear a Medic Alert bracelet at all times.

diagnosis.diagnosis_layman: adverse effects of drugs and toxins
diagnosis.diagnosis_symptoms: palpitations, stomach pain, upper abdominal pain, vomiting
diagnosis.diagnosis_category: allergies, behavioral/psychological/psychiatry, cardiac, eye diseases, gastrointestinal, hematological, orthopedics, dermatology, other

diagnosis.diagnosis_layman: effects on body from frequent and heavy alcohol consumption
diagnosis.diagnosis_symptoms: passing out, poor appetite, stomach pain, upper abdominal pain
diagnosis.diagnosis_category: behavioral/psychological/psychiatry, gastrointestinal, liver gallbladder and bile ducts, neurology, nutrition, muscles, addiction problems

diagnosis.diagnosis_symptoms: stomach pain, stomach swelling, upper abdominal pain, vomiting
diagnosis.diagnosis_homecare: 1) Do not drink alcohol., 2) Avoid caffeine., 3) Drink plenty of liquids., 4) Eat a low fat diet., 5) Take prescribed medications as directed by your doctor.
